com.adonax.audiocue

Class AudioCue

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adonax.audiocue.AudioCue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AudioMixerTrack

    public class AudioCue
extends java.lang.Object
implements AudioMixerTrack
    The AudioCue represents a segment of audio media that is loaded into memory prior to playback and which offers minimal latency, concurrent playback of instances, and real time controls for volume, panning and playback speed of each instance. The AudioCue combines and builds upon many features of the javax.sound.sampled.Clip and javafx.scene.media.AudioClip. Data is loaded either from a "CD Quality" wav file (44100 fps, 16-bit, little-endian) or a float array that conforms to this format, and stored in an internal float array as normalized values with the range [-1.0, 1.0].

    Unlike a Clip or AudioClip the play method returns an int hook to the playable instance. You can ignore the hook and use the play method in a fire-and-forget manner, in which case the instance hook is automatically returned to the pool of available instances when play completes. Alternatively, you can use the hook as a parameter to specify an instance to start or stop (in effect, pause) or to position the "play head" to any sample frame, or to set other properties of the instance such as the number of repetitions. The hook can also be used to designate the target instance for setting or modulating the volume, pan, or play speed while it is playing. This provides a reliable alternative to the use of a javax.sound.sampled.Control for smooth volume fade-ins and fade-outs, as well as a basis for pitch-based effects such as Doppler shifting.

    Internally, a javax.sound.sampled.SourceDataLine is used for output. When you open the AudioCue, the line is configured with a buffer size of 1024 frames (4192 bytes) and a thread priority of HIGHEST. Alternative values can be specified as parameters to the open method.

    Version:
    AudioCue 1.1
    Author:
    Philip Freihofner
    See Also:
    http://adonax.com/AudioCue

      • setName

        Parameters:

      • addAudioCueListener

        public void addAudioCueListener(AudioCueListener listener)
        Registers an AudioCueListener to receive notifications of events pertaining to the AudioCue and its playing or playable instances.

        Notifications occur on the thread which processes the audio signal, and includes events such as the starting, stopping, and looping of instances. Implementations of the methods that receive these notifications should be coded for brevity in order to minimize extraneous processing on the audio thread.

        Parameters:
        listener - a class implementing the AudioCueListener interface

      • removeAudioCueListener

        public void removeAudioCueListener(AudioCueListener listener)
        Removes an AudioCueListener from receiving notifications of events pertaining to the AudioCue and its playing instances.
        Parameters:
        listener - a class implementing the AudioCueListener interface

      • setPanType

        public void setPanType(AudioCue.PanType panType)
        Assigns the type of panning to be used.
        Parameters:
        panType - a member of the enum AudioCue.PanType
        See Also:
        AudioCue.PanType

      • makeStereoCue

        public static AudioCue makeStereoCue(float[] cue,
                                     java.lang.String name,
                                     int polyphony)
        Creates and returns a new AudioCue. This method allows the direct insertion of a float array as an argument, where the data is presumed to conform to the "CD Quality" format: 44100 frames per second, 16-bit encoding, stereo, little-endian. The maximum number of concurrent playing instances is given as the polyphony argument. The polyphony value can not be changed. A large value may require additional buffering and result in noticeable lag in order to prevent drop outs.
        Parameters:
        cue - a float array of audio data in "CD Quality" format, scaled to the range [-1, 1]
        name - a String to be associated with the AudioCue
        polyphony - an int specifying the maximum number of concurrent instances
        Returns:
        AudioCue

      • makeStereoCue

        public static AudioCue makeStereoCue(java.net.URL url,
                                     int polyphony)
                              throws javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException,
                                     java.io.IOException
        Creates and returns a new AudioCue. A URL for a WAV file to be loaded is provided. At this point, only one format, known as "CD Quality", is supported: 44100 frames per second, 16-bit encoding, stereo, little-endian. The maximum number of concurrent playing instances is given as the polyphony argument. The polyphony value can not be changed. A large value may require additional buffering and result in noticeable lag in order to prevent drop outs.

        The file name provided by the URL is automatically used as the name for the AudioCue, but can be changed via the method setName.

        Parameters:
        url - a URL for the source file
        polyphony - an int specifying the maximum number of concurrent instances
        Returns:
        AudioCue
        Throws:
        javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException - if the media is not a WAV file of "CD Quality"
        java.io.IOException - if unable to load the file

      • open

        public void open()
          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                 javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException
        Allocates resources for media play, using default Mixer, thread priority and buffer size values. The AudioCueListener will broadcast a notification using the method audioCueOpened.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the player is already open
        javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException - if unable to obtain a SourceDataLine for the player

      • open

        public void open(int bufferFrames)
          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                 javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException
        Allocates resources for media play, using the default Mixer and thread priority values, while setting the internal a custom buffer size. The AudioCueListener will broadcast a notification using the method audioCueOpened.
        Parameters:
        bufferFrames - number of stereo frames
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the player is already open
        javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException - if unable to obtain a SourceDataLine for the player

      • open

        public void open(javax.sound.sampled.Mixer mixer,
                 int bufferFrames,
                 int threadPriority)
          throws javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException,
                 java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Allocates resources for media play, setting explicit values to over ride the defaults. The AudioCueListener will broadcast a notification using the method audioCueOpened.
        Parameters:
        mixer - a javax.sound.sampled.Mixer
        bufferFrames - an int specifying the size of the internal buffer
        threadPriority - an int specifying the priority level of the thread, ranging [1, 10]
        Throws:
        javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException - if unable to obtain a SourceDataLine for the player
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the AudioCue is already open

      • open

        public void open(AudioMixer audioMixer)
          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Assigns an AudioMixer, instead of an internal AudioCuePlay, for media playback. The buffer size and thread priority of the AudioMixer will be used for playback. The AudioCueListener will broadcast a notification using the method audioCueOpened.
        Parameters:
        audioMixer -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Releases resources allocated for media play. The AudioCueListener will broadcast a notification using the method audioCueClosed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if player is already closed

      • obtainInstance

        public int obtainInstance()
        Obtains an int hook from a pool of available instances. The AudioCueListener method obtainedInstance will be called. If no playable instances are available, the method returns -1. An instance obtained by this method does not recycle back into the pool of available instances when it finishes playing. To put the instance back in the pool of availables, the method releaseInstance must be called.
        Returns:
        an int hook to the playing instance, or -1 if no instances are available

      • releaseInstance

        public void releaseInstance(int instanceHook)
        Releases an AudioCue instance, making it available for a new play method. The AudioCueListener method releaseInstance will be called.
        Parameters:
        instanceHook - int hook identifying the cue instance to be released

      • play

        public int play()
        Plays an available AudioCue instance from the start of the audio data, at full volume, center pan, and at normal speed, or, returns -1 if no AudioCue instance is available. If an AudioCue instance is able to play, the AudioCueListener methods createInstance and startInstance will be called. When the instance finishes playing it will be automatically recycled into the pool of available instances.

        For best response time (lowest latency), the play method should be called on an AudioCue that has already been opened, as opening requires the creation of an audio thread and the acquisition of an output line.

        Returns:
        an int hook to the playing instance, or -1 if no instance is available

      • play

        public int play(double volume)
        Plays an available AudioCue instance from the start of the audio data at the given volume, at center pan, and at normal speed, or, returns -1 if no AudioCue instance is available. If an AudioCue instance is able to play, the AudioCueListener methods createInstance and startInstance will be called. When the instance finishes playing it will be automatically recycled into the pool of available instances.

        For best response time (lowest latency), the play method should be called on an AudioCue that has already been opened, as opening requires the creation of an audio thread and the acquisition of an output line.

        Parameters:
        volume - a double in the range [0, 1]
        Returns:
        an int hook to the playing instance, or -1 if no instance is available

      • play

        public int play(double volume,
                double pan,
                double speed,
                int loop)
        Plays an available AudioCue instance from the start of the audio data, at center pan, and at the specified speed, or, returns -1 if no AudioCue instance is available. If an AudioCue instance is able to play, the AudioCueListener notifications createInstance and startInstance will be sent to all registered listeners. When the instance finishes playing it will be automatically recycled into the pool of available instances.

        For best response time (lowest latency), the play method should be called on an AudioCue that has already been opened, as opening requires the creation of an audio thread and the acquisition of an output line.

        Parameters:
        volume - a double within the range [0, 1]
        pan - a double within the range [-1, 1]
        speed - a double that becomes the frame rate
        loop - an int that specifies a number of additional plays (looping)
        Returns:
        an int hook to the playing instance, or -1 if no instance is available

      • start

        public void start(int instanceHook)
           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Plays the specified AudioCue instance from its current position within the sound cue, using current volume, pan, and speed settings. The AudioCueListener method startInstance will be called.
        Parameters:
        instanceHook - an int used to identify an AudioCue instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if instance is not active or if instance is playing

      • stop

        public void stop(int instanceHook)
          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sends message to indicate that the playing of the cue associated with the hook should be paused. The AudioCueListener method stopInstance will be called. Sending this message to an already stopped instance does nothing. Once an instance is stopped, it will be left in an active state until it is explicitly released.
        Parameters:
        instanceHook - an int used to identify an AudioCue instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if instance is not active

      • setFramePosition

        public void setFramePosition(int instanceHook,
                             double frame)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the play position ("play head") to a specified sample frame. The frame count is zero-based. The new play position can include a fractional sample amount. The new sample frame position will be clamped to a value that lies within the AudioCue. When the instance is restarted, it will commence from this sample frame.
        Parameters:
        instanceHook - an int used to identify an AudioCue instance
        frame - the sample frame number from which play will commence when the next start method is executed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if instance is not active or if instance is playing

      • getFramePosition

        public double getFramePosition(int instanceHook)
        Returns the current sample frame number. The frame count is zero-based. The position may lie in between two frames.
        Parameters:
        instanceHook - an int used to identify an AudioCue instance
        Returns:
        a double corresponding to the current sample frame position
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if instance is not active

      • setMillisecondPosition

        public void setMillisecondPosition(int instanceHook,
                                   int milliseconds)
        Repositions the play position ("play head") of the given AudioCue instance to the sample frame that corresponds to the specified elapsed time in milliseconds. The new play position can include a fractional sample amount. The new sample frame position will be clamped to a value that lies within the AudioCue. When the instance is restarted, it will commence from this sample frame.
        Parameters:
        instanceHook - an int used to identify an AudioCue instance
        milliseconds - an int in milliseconds that corresponds to the desired starting point for the AudioCue instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if instance is not active or if instance is playing

      • setFractionalPosition

        public void setFractionalPosition(int instanceHook,
                                  double normal)
        Repositions the play position ("play head") of the given AudioCue instance to the sample frame that corresponds to the specified elapsed fractional part the total audio cue length. The new play position can include a fractional sample amount. Arguments are clamped to the range [0..1]. When restarted, the audio cue will commence from the new sample frame position.
        Parameters:
        instanceHook - an int used to identify the AudioCue instance
        normal - a double in the range [0..1] that corresponds to the desired starting point for the AudioCue instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if instance is not active or if instance is playing

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(int instanceHook,
                      double volume)
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the volume of the instance. Volumes can be altered while a cue is playing with a latency largely determined by the buffer setting specified in the open method in combination with a smoothing algorithm used to prevent signal discontinuities that result in audible clicks or other forms of distortion. Volumes can be altered concurrently, with the most recent call taking precedence over and interrupting previous calls. Arguments are clamped to the range [0..1] and thus can only diminish, not amplify, the volume.

        Internally, the volume argument is used as a factor that is directly multiplied against the media's sample values, and it should be noted that this linear scaling of sample values is not proportional with the human sense of loudness.

        Parameters:
        instanceHook - an int used to identify the AudioCue instance
        volume - a float in the range [0, 1] to be multiplied against the audio sample values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if instance is not active

      • getVolume

        public double getVolume(int instanceHook)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns a value indicating the current volume setting of an AudioCue instance, ranging [0..1].
        Parameters:
        instanceHook - an int used to identify the AudioCue instance
        Returns:
        volume factor as a double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if instance is not active

      • setPan

        public void setPan(int instanceHook,
                   double pan)
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the pan of the instance, where 100% left corresponds to -1, 100% right corresponds to 1, and center = 0. The pan setting can be changed while a cue is playing with a latency largely determined by the buffer setting specified in the open method in combination with a smoothing algorithm used to prevent signal discontinuities that result in audible clicks or other forms of distortion. Pans can be altered concurrently, with the most recent call taking precedence over and interrupting previous calls. Arguments are clamped to the range [-1, 1].

        For stereo AudioCues, a volume-based pan is performed. The calculation is performed by method specified by AudioCue.Pan.

        Parameters:
        instanceHook - an int used to identify the AudioCue instance
        pan - a double ranging from -1 to 1
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if instance is not active
        See Also:
        AudioCue.PanType

      • getPan

        public double getPan(int instanceHook)
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns a double in the range [-1, 1] where -1 indicates 100% left and 1 indicates 100% right.
        Parameters:
        instanceHook - an int used to identify the AudioCue instance
        Returns:
        the current pan value, ranging [-1, 1]
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if instance is not active

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(int instanceHook,
                     double speed)
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the play speed of the AudioCue instance. A faster speed results in both higher-pitched frequency content and a shorter duration. Play speeds can be altered in real time while a cue is playing with a latency largely determined by the buffer setting specified in the open method in combination with a smoothing algorithm used to prevent signal discontinuities. Speeds can be altered concurrently, with the most recent call taking precedence over and interrupting previous calls. A speed of 1 will play the AudioCue instance at its originally recorded speed. A value of 2 will double the play speed, and a value of 0.5 will halve the play speed. Arguments are clamped to values ranging from 8 times slower to 8 times faster than unity, a range of [0.125, 8].

        Note that the determination of what is an effective amount of speed-up or slow-down depends upon the frequency content of the original sample, thus "safe bounds" for the speed argument are difficult to specify. Thus, it is possible to enter values that result in signals that are either too low or too high in frequency to be audible.

        Parameters:
        instanceHook - an int used to identify an AudioCue instance
        speed - a double factor ranging from 0.125 to 8 (1/8th to 8 times the original speed)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if instance is not active

      • getSpeed

        public double getSpeed(int instanceHook)
                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns a factor indicating the current rate of play of the AudioCue instance relative to normal play.
        Parameters:
        instanceHook - an int used to identify an AudioCue instance
        Returns:
        a float factor indicating the speed at which the AudioCue instance is being played in the range [0.125, 8]
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if instance is not active

      • setLooping

        public void setLooping(int instanceHook,
                       int loops)
                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the number of times the media will restart from the beginning, after completing, or specifies infinite looping via the value -1. Note: an instance set to loop 2 times will play back a total of 3 times.
        Parameters:
        instanceHook - an int used to identify an AudioCue instance
        loops - an int that specifies the number of times an instance will return to the beginning and play again
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if instance is not active

      • setRecycleWhenDone

        public void setRecycleWhenDone(int instanceHook,
                               boolean recycleWhenDone)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets a flag which determines what happens when the instance finishes playing. If true the instance will be added to the pool of available instances and will no longer allow updates. If false then the instance will remain available for updates. By default, an instance that is obtained via a play method recycles, and an instance obtained via getInstance will not. But in both cases the behavior can be changed by setting this flag.
        Parameters:
        instanceHook - an int used to identify an AudioCue instance
        recycleWhenDone - a boolean that designates the behavior ("recycle" or not) that occurs when the instance finishes playing
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the instance is not active

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if instance is playing, false if not
